meanings.definition: A quantity or number of things or people dealt with at the same time
meanings.sent1: The bakery made several batches of cookies for the event.
meanings.sent2: She divided the tasks into smaller batches to manage them better.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to handle a large batch of energetic students today.
meanings.sent4: The team processed the data in batches, like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The factory produced batches of colorful candies, filling the room with sweetness.

meanings.definition: A group of things or people dealt with at the same time
meanings.sent1: The volunteers worked in batches to clean up the park.
meanings.sent2: The company assigned different batches of employees to various projects.
meanings.sent3: The children formed batches to play different games in the field.
meanings.sent4: The chef organized the ingredients into batches for efficient cooking.
meanings.sent5: The team of doctors treated patients in batches, ensuring no one was left waiting.

meanings.definition: A quantity of material prepared or processed at one time
meanings.sent1: The factory produced large batches of fabric for the new collection.
meanings.sent2: The chef mixed the ingredients in small batches for the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The students conducted experiments using small batches of chemicals.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted in batches, completing sections of the mural at a time.
meanings.sent5: The farmer harvested batches of ripe fruits from the orchard, ready for sale.
